body.p: The maximum length of a queue can be limited to a set number of messages by supplying the x-max-length queue declaration argument with a non-negative integer value. Queue length is a measure that takes into account ready messages, ignoring unacknowledged messages and message size. Messages will be dropped or dead-lettered from the front of the queue to make room for new messages once the limit is reached.
